intro: Scutellaria orizabensis, commonly known as the Orizaba skullcap, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
